intro: Marsdenia cryptostemma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, greenish-white flowers are typically clustered in umbels, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
